courses.title: Scientific Foundations of Health
courses.description: Students will learn how genetics, the environment and human behavior influence well-being.  Topics include health fitness, immunity, nutrition, stress management and chronic disease prevention. Credit not allowed for both APPH 1040 and APPH 1050 or HPS 1040 or APPH 1060.

courses.title: The Science of Physical Activity and Health
courses.description: Students will learn the importance of health fitness, good nutrition, stress management and chronic disease prevention.  Activity portion of course will focus on training to improve fitness.  Credit not allowed for both APPH 1050 and HPS 1040 or APPH 1040 or APPH 1060.

courses.title: Flourishing: Strategies for Well-being and Resilience
courses.description: This course is designed to help students improve their health/well-being and flourish by using conceptual pillars such as coping, resiliency, optimism, mindfulness, and emotional intelligence. Credit not awarded for both APPH 1060 and APPH 1040 or APPH 1050.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in applied physiology.

courses.title: Special Problems
courses.description: Individual studies in applied physiology.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in applied physiology.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of current interest in applied physiology.

courses.title: Clinical Gait Analysis
courses.description: Analysis of normal and pathological human locomotion. Study of theory and instrumentation for measurement of temporal and spatial kinematics and kinetics, electromyography, and plantar pressure.

courses.title: Biomechanics and Kinesiology in Prosthetics and Orthotics
courses.description: Mechanics of human movement applied to the study of artifical limbs and braces. Emphasis on neuromuscular control, Newtonian mechanics, kinematics and kinetics.

courses.title: Clinical Pathology
courses.description: Systems level overview of human pathology with emphasis on the effect of disease on human movement and neuromechanical function.

courses.title: Systems Physiology I: Cellular Mechanisms of Plasticity
courses.description: The course will focus on adaptations of skeletal, muscular, and neural systems at the cellular level.

courses.title: Systems Physiology II: Physiology of Neuromotor Tissues
courses.description: The course will focus on function and adaptations of skeletal, muscular, and neural systems. Interactions among the various systems and their plasticity will be emphasized.

courses.title: Systems Physiology III: Integrated Systems and Adaptation
courses.description: The course will focus on integrative mechanism impacting motor system performance. Interactions among the various systems and their plasticity will be emphasized.

courses.title: Laboratory Rotations in Prosthetics and Orthotics
courses.description: This course will provide the opportunity for students in individual laboratories to support their graduate training in prosthetics and orthotics.

courses.title: Studies in Responsible Conduct of Research in Prosthetics and Orthotics
courses.description: This course will cover areas related to research ethics, the responsible use of animial and human models and collaborative research issues in prosthetics and orthotics.

courses.title: Studies in Rehabilitation Research: Prosthetics and Orthotics
courses.description: This course will provide students in the PhD Training Program in Prosthetics and Orthotics to study issues in Rehabilitation Medicine.

courses.title: Biostatistics
courses.description: Introductory statistical principles and methods of experimental design, sampling, power estimation, and hypothesis testing using ANOVA and regression.

courses.title: Exercise Metabolism
courses.description: The course will focus on the biochemical pathways that provide fuel for the human body during rest and various levels of physical activity.

courses.title: Biomechanical Aspects of Human Motor Control
courses.description: The course will examine selected motor control problems that the nervous system faces in the process of managing this mechanical complexity.

courses.title: Locomotion Neuromechanics
courses.description: This is a course that will introduce topics  on the biomechanical and neural aspects of the control of limbed locomotion and movement.

courses.title: The Aging Movement Control System
courses.description: The aim of this course is to review research literature dealing with the effects of advances in age on the CNS and motor performance.

courses.title: Mechanics and Pathomechanics of Movement Control
courses.description: This course is designed to understand the potential effects of selected disorders of the neuromuscular system on movement control.

courses.title: Neuromuscular Physiology
courses.description: This course discusses the application of current experimental techniques in human studies in vivo.

courses.title: Methods of Human Neuroimaging
courses.description: The purpose of the course is to introduce various methods of functional neuroimaging in humans.

courses.title: Ion Channels in Health and Disease
courses.description: This course will examine the structure, function and regulation of ion channels from both excitable and non-excitable cells.

courses.title: Movement Disorders
courses.description: This course serves as an introduction to the clinical and research aspects of movement disorders.

courses.title: Cellular Physiology and Adaptation
courses.description: This course will focus on adaptations of skeletal, muscular and neural systems at the cellular level.

courses.title: Neuromotor Physiology
courses.description: The course will focus on function and adaptations of the skeletal, muscular and neural systems. Interactions among various systems and their plasticity will be emphasized.

courses.title: Integrative Physiology
courses.description: The course will focus on integrative mechanisms impacting motor system performance. Interactions among the various systems and their plasticity will be emphasized.

courses.title: Human Neuroanatomy
courses.description: The purpose of this course is to learn the anatomical makeup of the human nervous system.  In this course we will closely examine details of central and peripheral neuroanatomy with links to function.  As well, comparisons with non-human vertebrate neuroanatomy will be made.

courses.title: Classics in Neuroscience
courses.description: The purpose of this seminar is to learn and explore the history of neuroscience from a perspective of reading classic papers that have evolved.

courses.title: Muscle Structure and Plasticity
courses.description: Covers the biological processes underlying skeletal muscle structure and function, as well as rigorous mathematical models of those processes.

courses.title: Ethics of Biotechnology and Bioengineering Research
courses.description: This course examines the ethics of biotechnological research, including issues in the realm of research ethics, bioethics, and healthcare robotics.

courses.title: Lower Limb Orthotics I
courses.description: This course is the first part of a two course series and sets the essential elements of theory, technical design and patient management.

courses.title: Upper Limb Prosthetics
courses.description: Clinical training for the practice of prosthetics emphasizing adult and pediatric upper limb prostheses.

courses.title: Spinal Orthotics
courses.description: Clinical training for the practice of orthotics emphasizing adult and pediatric spinal orthoses.

courses.title: Upper Limb Orthotics
courses.description: Clinical training for the practice of orthotics emphasizing adult and pediatric upper limb orthoses.

courses.title: Transfemoral Prosthetics
courses.description: Clinical training for the practice of prosthetics emphasizing adult and pediatric transfemoral (above knee) prostheses.

courses.title: Assistive Technology
courses.description: Theories and devices associated with assistive technology and mobility aids, emphasizing topics important to clinical practice in prosthetics and orthotics.

courses.title: Clinical Practicum in Prosthetics and Orthotics
courses.description: Clinical observation of the practice of prosthetics and orthotics and related medical disciplines.

courses.title: Seminar
courses.description: The purpose of this course is for students to learn the research process from the early stage of identifying a question through publication of work.

courses.title: Research Seminar I
courses.description: A forum for graduate students in prosthetics and orthotics to present topics related to their research interests.

courses.title: Research Seminar II
courses.description: A forum for graduate students in prosthetics and orthotics to present and discuss topics related to their research interests.

courses.title: Research Seminar III
courses.description: A forum for graduate students in prosthetics and orthotics to present topics related to their research interests.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Topics of special interest not covered in the regular course offerings.
